intro: Pouteria dissepala, commonly known as the Brazilian nut tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Amazon basin. It is characterized by its large, compound leaves and produces fruits that contain the highly nutritious seeds known as Brazil nuts. The plant belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is known for its ability to thrive in humid, tropical climates. Its fruit develops from an inferior ovary and is typically clustered in panicles. The tree can grow up to 30 meters tall and is valued for both its ecological and economic importance.
